Why are the font styling options greyed out when using custom fonts? It makes it hard for blog authors to format posts quickly when the default font matches a custom font.

I put my font.json as a reply in this thread.

Hey everyone. I'm working on a child theme of a free marketplace theme. I've cloned a module I need to make changes to but it's telling me there are 2 internal errors. Does anyone know what might be causing this or where I might be able to find a more descriptive error message? I haven't changed anything about the module yet
I'm dealing with this same problem right now. Have you found a solution? Let me know if you do.

Unfortunately, I had to teach my client how to manually input `<strong>` and `<em>` tags using the source code viewer. Not much of a solution.

In the future, I just won’t be integrating my custom fonts through HubSpot’s custom font functionality — I’ll just do it the old-fashioned way, then provide a couple of custom modules for scenarios where more type flexibility is needed.

I think it could work for fancier fonts that are used for stuff like headings or callouts, but for body font, my solution was to just use standard @font-face import and set the that as the default for blog posts and rich text. That way, we still have a custom font that supports the *B* and _I_ buttons and if they ever want to select that font, they can click the "Clear Styles" button.
Yup, I’ve taken that approach in previous projects and I think it’s definitely the correct way to go. The HS Custom Font functionality just isn’t mature enough for primetime, as it is.
Do you know when it came out as a feature?
Seems like the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/themes/custom-fonts|KB article> was updated in Dec 2022. Does that mean it's a new feature and still being actively worked on?

It’s relatively new — definitely released within the last ~18 months.

A lot of dev tools and CMS features seem to have been abandoned after the big round of layoffs earlier this year, so it’s hard to say whether it’s still under active development.

sometimes HubSpot will flag an error in Design Tools that isn't flagged via the CLI (how the theme developer uploads the theme) and sometimes the errors don't prevent the module from working as expected, it depends on whether it's a warning or error. Is it letting you edit and publish or are the errors preventing you from publishing changes?
